intro: Botryodendrum taitense, commonly known as the Taiti starwort, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It grows in wetland habitats and is often found in swampy areas along the coast. Botryodendrum taitense is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
